data.text: The decimal expansion of is non-terminating and recurring.
Mean of first ten natural numbers = __________.
The graph of y = P(x) is given below. The number of zeroes of P(x) is __________.
The lines representing the pair of equations __________, are parallel.
The discriminant (b^2 - 4ac) of the quadratic equation 3x^2-6x+2=0 is __________.
For an A.P., if a = 7, d = 3 and n = 8 then a_n = __________.
The distance of M(x, y) from the origin O(0, 0) is __________.
The angle subtended by a minute hand of a clock at the centre of the clock in 10 minutes is __________.
The formula to find the volume of a sphere is __________.
If the zeroes of the quadratic polynomial P(x) = ax^2 + bx + c (a \neq 0) \alpha and \beta, then \alpha\beta = __________.
The probability of an event cannot be __________.
\sqrt{3x} + 5 is a linear polynomial.
The common difference of A.P. 10, 8, 6, 4, ----- is 2.
\sin A = \cos A for all values of A.
There is only one tangent at a point of the circle.
3 (Mean) = Mode + 2 (Median).
The sum of the probabilities of all the elementary events of an experiment is 1.
The graph of P(x) = x^2 + 3x + 2 is a __________ (ray, line, parabola)
A circle can have __________ parallel tangents at the most. (two, three, infinitely many)
If the perimeter and the area of a circle are numerically equal, then the radius of the circle is __________ (\pi, 4, 2)
The class mark of the class 30-40 is __________ (30, 35, 40)
The probability of Sun setting in the west is __________ (-1, 0, 1)
Find a quadratic polynomial, the sum and the product of whose zeroes are 0 and -3.
Divide x^2 + 7x + 10 by x + 5 and write the quotient and the remainder.
Find the roots of the quadratic equation \sqrt{2}x^2 + 7x + 5\sqrt{2} = 0 by factorization.
In a flower bed, there are 25 rose plants in the first row, 23 in the second, 21 in the third and so on. There are 5 rose plants in the last row. How many rows are there in the flower bed?
Find the sum of first 10 terms of the A.P. -10, -5, 0, 5, -----.
Find a point on the y-axis which is equidistant from the points P(6, 5) and Q(-4, 3).
Evaluate: 2 \tan^2 45^\circ – \cos^2 30^\circ + \sin^2 60^\circ.
If \sin \theta = \frac{3}{4}, calculate \cos \theta and \tan \theta.
The angle of elevation of the top of a tower from a point on the ground, which is 60 m away from the foot of the tower is 30°. Find the height of the tower.
A tangent PA at a point P of a circle of radius 5 cm meets a line through the centre 'O' at a point A, so that OA = 12 cm. Find PA.
Two cubes each of side 5 cm are joined end to end. Find the surface area of the resulting cuboid.
A cone of height 24 cm and radius of base 6 cm is made up of modelling clay. Rahul reshapes it in the form of a sphere. Find the radius of the sphere.
Find the mode of the following data.
Two players Sania and Sangeeta play a tennis match. It is known that, the probability of Sania winning the match is 0.57. What is the probability of Sangeeta winning the match?
Solve the pair of equations: 2x + 3y = 7, 3x – 4y = 2 by elimination method.
The sum and the difference of two numbers are 18 and 2 respectively. Find the numbers.
The sum of the reciprocals of Jayesh's ages (in years) 3 years ago and 5 years from now is \frac{1}{3}. Find his present age.
Find the sum of first 51 terms of an A.P. whose second and third terms are 14 and 18 respectively.
How many three digit numbers are divisible by 7?
Find the area of the triangle whose vertices are P(1, -1), Q(–4, 6) and R(–3, −5).
If A(1,2), B(4, y), C(x, 6) and D(3, 5) are the vertices of a parallelogram taken in order, find x and y.
A toy is in the form of a cone of radius 3.5 cm mounted on a hemisphere of same radius. The total height of the toy is 15.5 cm. Find the total surface area of the toy.
Find the mean of the following data.
Find the median of the following data.

One card is drawn from a well-shuffled deck of 52 cards. Find the probability of getting
i) a king of red colour
ii) a face card
iii) a spade

A box contains 90 discs which are numbered from 1 to 90. If one disc is drawn at random from the box, find the probability that it bears
i) a two digit number
ii) a perfect square number
iii) a number divisible by 5.
In triangle ABC, \angle B = 90°. Prove that AC^2 = AB^2 + BC^2.
If the square of one side of a triangle is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides, then prove that the angle opposite to the first side is a right angle.
Draw a line segment of length 7 cm and divide it in the ratio 3:5. Write the steps of construction.
Draw two tangents to a circle of radius 5 cm, which are inclined at an angle of 60° to each other.
The median of the following data is 8.05. Find the values of a and b, if the total frequency is 100.
